description: One incident led to another.
An incident has an impact on the victim or specific infrastructure.
The incident has been attributed to the intrusion set or threat actor.
An incident was targeted at the victim or specific infrastructure.
The incident occurred at a specific location or locations.
The incident in question is part of the campaign that is associated with
An identity should be considered a point of contact for an incident. This can be used to supplement the created_by_ref in cases where external authorship would prevent using it for this purpose.
An indicator was responsible for detecting the incident.
One event led to another. For example a dropper running allowed a ransomware tool to be downloaded and run.
An event has an impact on specific infrastructure.
The event occurred at a specific location or locations.
STIX cyber-observables were observed as part of this event, but no information on when they are observed is being shared. If this can be shared a Sighting it should be instead of using this method.
An indicator is based on an event.
Malware performed a specific event.
A tool performed a specific event.
An task uses a particular course of action.
A task was performed to block a potential event.
A task was performed that caused an event, usually due to an error.
A task was used to detect an event.
A task was performed that created an indicator.
A task has an impact on specific infrastructure.
The task occurred at a specific location or locations.
A task follows this one because of an error / if statement in a playbook.
A task follows this one in the normal chain of execution.
An identity has been assigned the task
An identity is a point of contact for this task.
An identity participated in a specific task, but as not the primary performer
An identity performed a specific task.
A tool performed a specific task.
